page.title: 05BUCHLYVIE VILLAGE SHOPS
page.content: Buchlyvie is supplied by four shops,{ {FORTH VALLEY COOPERATIVE SOCIETY, {J. MACKAY-BUTCHER, CENTRAL FARMERS, and a small{GENERAL STORE.}The Buchlyvie Branch of the CO-OP was opened in{1921.}Until recently it supplied coal, milk, meat, drapery items and groceries. It also had vans to supply farms and outlying areas.Now in{1985}it no longer has delivery vans and coal is supplied by coalmen from the town of{STIRLING}but most of the other services, as well as an undertaking service, remain. The{BUTCHER}originally had it's own killing house, but is now supplied by a wholesaler direct from the abbatoir. {CENTRAL FARMERS}as it's name implies, supplies local farms with protective clothing, pesticides, animal health products and ironmongery.{ { }
